thread.title: Raffl collapses on Flyers bench after hit to head
thread.title_full: Raffl collapses on Flyers bench after hit to head

title: Raffl collapses on Flyers bench after hit to head
text:
Sam Carchidi, Inquirer Staff Writer Posted: Sunday, October 25, 2015, 3:01 AM 
In a scary-looking scene early in the second period Saturday night against the Rangers, Flyers top-line left winger Michael Raffl collapsed on the bench and had to be helped to the locker room. 
The Flyers would only call it an upper-body injury, but Raffl may have suffered a concussion. 
On his previous shift, Raffl was pursuing Jaret Stoll and inadvertently skated into the Ranger forward's left elbow, which appeared to hit him in the head. 
Raffl, who suffered a concussion last year, was replaced by Brayden Schenn on the top line. More coverage
